prs.title: Un-vendor OZ
prs.truncated_body:
This PR does not change any wrapper bytecode!

Removes the vendored OZ versions in favour of NPM dependencies. 


Next steps: try to upgrade all 4.x to 4.9.6 and all 5.x to 5.1.0


CI is expected to be red, one is the frozen contracts checker, the other complains about 4.7.3 which was always in vendor so the issue isn't new or made worse by this PR.

prs.title: op-interop-mon: Refactor Metric Collection and Emission
prs.truncated_body:
A significant change to the metric emissions of `op-interop-mon`

## The Problem
`op-interop-mon` had been designed to emit message stats with these dimensions:
- Executing Chain ID
- Executing BlockNum
- Executing BlockHash
- Message Validity (unknown, valid, invalid)

The inclusion of BlockNum and BlockHash meant the cardinality of these dimensions is unbounded, and thus we would incur

Stronger language in reorg log

prs.title: op-service: txintent binding 128bit uint/int type support

Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

**Description**

Supports 128bit uint/int type support for abi encoding. Decoding is only supported when we are returning the integer solely, not tuple nor structs, arrays.

Added new types:

type Int128 big.Int
```

prs.title: op-node: Handle duplicate outgoing supervisor events
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

* Removes emitting `StepReqEvent` inside `SyncDeriver.onIncomingP2PBlock` - this was causing an avalanche of exhaust l1 events
* Deduplicate sending the same supervisor events from a managed node with a TTL until the same message is resend.
    * Complete duplication is also dangerous, as a supervisor may be restarting and miss state.

**Tests**

Added unit test of new `ev

prs.title: op-devstack: Support time travel
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Add time travel support to the dev stack presets. Only supported in sysgo since kurtosis uses a real L1 CL client.

Provides a preset option to enable time travel (and gate on its availability):
```go
presets.DoMain(m, presets.WithSuperInterop(), presets.WithTimeTravel())
```

and then can be used from the preset system easily:

```go
	sys := presets.NewSimpleInterop(t

commits.message:
op-devstack: Support time travel

Only supported in sysgo since kurtosis uses a real L1 CL client.

prs.title: feat: ERC20MigrationOutbox
prs.truncated_body:
# ERC20MigrationOutbox

## Overview
This PR introduces the `ERC20MigrationOutbox` contract, a new component designed to facilitate the migration of native tokens from the Arbitrum bridge to an external bridge on custom fee token orbit chains.

## Purpose
Some custom fee token orbit chains may want to have their native token managed by an external bridge rather than the built-in native bridge

prs.title: Relay Bridge Integration
prs.truncated_body:

- Separated native asset bridge action from erc20 so less calldata is passed by avoiding the token 0xEEEE... to refer to ETH
- Requires #356 to be merged first

Notes on Relayer:
- Sending more or less than expected is not problematic, Relayers will take any amount sent and apply the quote rate set which will affect the received

prs.title: Add RPC tracer regression tests
prs.truncated_body:
## Describe your changes and provide context
Added tests that use historical mainnet data as state to catch future regressions. To add a test for tx with has 0xabc:
1. call `debug_traceStateAccess` endpoint with 0xabc and store the entire response under `evmrpc/tests/mock_data/0xabc`
2. (optional) if the state access involves any wasm code (i.e. `0x01` prefix under wasm module), download the wa

prs.title: Simplify Base Fee - Deprecate CurrBaseFee
prs.truncated_body:
## Describe your changes and provide context
We currently do base fee adjustments in `AdjustDynamicBaseFeePerGas` which uses `CurrBaseFeePerGas` and `NextBaseFeePerGas` to store the base fee of block n-1 and block n, respectively. However, we actually don't need 2 separate places to store the base fee. We can just use the same place and update it in-place. This PR simplifies the base fee adjustme

prs.title: Fix restore methods in ltx
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

1. Add invariants so the `getRestored*` functions cannot be called on a child ltx.
2. Copy the parents' `mRestoredKeys` into the child when the child is created.
3. Stop returning a reference to `mRestoredKeys` for safety. This still isn't ideal. Maybe we should refactor how `LedgerTxn` stores and propagates restored keys.

Describe what this pull request does, whic

prs.title: feat: do not use aggregate key in stacks sign requests
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

Closes https://github.com/stacks-sbtc/sbtc/issues/1731.

## Changes

1. The signer now ignores the aggregate key field in the sign request from the coordinator. Instead the signer figures out the aggregate key themselves.
2. Deprecate the `aggregate_key` field of the `StacksTransactionSignRequest` struct. The signers will continue to send the aggregate key in that field but

commits.message:
Do not take the signer set as a variable
when loading a state machine
Do not take the threshold as a parameter either

Use the signer set from the config when creating
a state machine

Use the bootstrap signing set for creating the
coordinator state machine

Use the actual current signing set when choosing
the coordinator, which is currently the bootstrap
signing set

Forgot to update the signer set changes in
two places. :sad

fix: more consistent signer set state (#1715)

## Description

Closes https://github.com/stacks-sbtc/sbtc/issues/1714.

## Changes

1. Load the wallet using the `SignerState` in the context, saving us
from an expensive query.
2. Rename the current signer set variable in the `SignerState` to be the
refer to the fact that it is what is in the registry.

Update docstrings for current signer set and
remove some of the state functions.

Don't necessarily run DKG if the registry
does not have information of a key rotation
Set the min bitcoin block height

Do not use the aggregate key sent by the
coordinator when figuring out the current
signing set

Deprecate the aggregate key field in the
StacksTransactionSignRequest struct
Don't remove the assertions in the unit tests

prs.title: feat: skip coordinator tenure after a key rotation

## Description

Closes https://github.com/stacks-sbtc/sbtc/issues/1739

* After the coordinator submits a rotate-keys contract call, they now bail.

* Fix up the debug implementation for the `Public

prs.title: Capitalize secrets references
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

During a secrets cleanup, I incorrectly removed the docker secrets because they were reported as not being used. It turns out that the secrets lookup is _not_ case sensitive but my scan _was_ case sensitive... Whoops.

This aligns the docker secrets with the rest of the repo as being uppercase.

## How this works

capitalizes secret envs.

## How this was te

prs.title: BLS Components for Simplex
prs.truncated_body:

Introduces `BLSSigner` and `BLSVerifier` in the new `simplex` package for signing and verifying messages (e.g., votes) in Simplex consensus. `BLSVerifier` will be extended in future PRs to support quorum certificate verification and additional functionality.

- Migrated the codebase to Kotlin 2.0.0 1.
- Updated all Gradle configs and dependencies to use Kotlin 2.0.0.
- Fixed all compilation errors related to stricter null-safety in Kotlin 2.0 (added explicit !! where required in tests).
- Ensured all core modules and Besu plugins are compatible with the new Kotlin version.
- No changes to business

Hey @ligi sir gm, 

I know you're not actively merging PR because of the upcoming onchain registry. However, we just had our genesis mainnet, and there are many teams with automated deployment scripts still targeting this repo (including, but not limited to, Safe, Curve, and more). 

Asking all of them to fork this repo and change their deployment script is a big issue for everyone. 

As a p

commits.message: Update for TAC Mainnet and fix TAC Testnet

prs.title: Add cli option -max-pov-percentage <percent>
prs.truncated_body:
### What does it do?

- Add CLI option `--max-pov-percentage <percent>` and deprecate the old CLI option `--nimbus-full-pov`.
- Update Moonkit pin to include https://github.com/Moonsong-Labs/moonkit/pull/71

## ⚠️ Breaking Changes ⚠️

Now `--nimbus-full-pov` sets the PoV limit for the block builder to 85% instead of 100%. This safe margin must be maintained until https://github.com/parityte

This PR fixes the incorrect password issue in upgrade

- Also coalesce from `HEDERA_` prefix password env vars in the secrets template

Fixes #11389

**Notes for reviewer**:
Old passwords from `HEDERA_` env vars will get lost if upgrading from charts < 0.130.0 to >= 0.130.0, given the passwords were initially auto generated by the template.

**

prs.title: Fix GitHub Actions build issue by targeting only .NET 9
prs.truncated_body:
## Problem

The GitHub Actions workflow was failing with a package downgrade error:

```
error NU1605: Warning As Error: Detected package downgrade: Neo from 3.8.1 to 3.8.1-CI01961
```

## Root Cause

The workflow was attempting to build `Neo.SmartContract.Testing` for both `netstandard2.1` and `net9.0`, but the project file only targets `net9.0`. This created a dependency resolution con

commits.message:
Fix GitHub Actions build issue by targeting only .NET 9

- Remove netstandard2.1 target from Neo.SmartContract.Testing build step
- Prevents package downgrade error between Neo 3.8.1 and 3.8.1-CI01961
- Aligns with project's net9.0 target framework specification

Fixes the error:
error NU1605: Warning As Error: Detected package downgrade: Neo from 3.8.1 to 3.8.1-CI01961

SafeAttribute supports in properties (#1330)

* SafeAttribute supports in properties

* Update Nep11Token.cs

* Safe setters are not allowed
